formattedAddress: 225 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 225 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Landmark theater venue founded in 1913 with diverse architecture & rich history of plays & musicals.

originalText.text: Came here to see Some Like it Hot THREE times! And I would come back more if I could!This musical is the best in the city! Mezzanine level has great sight lines for everything to be seen on stage. The theatre is good too. Friendly staff, efficient aisles for seating, and well kept facility. My only issue are the small restrooms; 2-3 stalls on the mezzanine level and one below the orchestra level. It was not very conducive for the crowd so make sure you use the restroom before you come!

originalText.text: Old school theater. The upper level terrace which was on tge 3rd level had seating that was just too steep to get to and a very narrow row to walk in and sit. I am short and upon sitting my knees hovered over the row in front of me.  If walking up a few flights of stairs or a steep decent is an issue then I recommend floor seats. It's a small theater too.

originalText.text:
The Schubert Theater, in the heart of Broadway opened in 1913. With beautiful Italian Renaissance design, it seats 1500 on three levels.

Came here twice to see Some Like it Hot.  Such a great show.  If you‚Äôre looking for a nice evening of pure fun and good song and dance, this is it.  Closing December 30 so if you haven‚Äôt been and you‚Äôre in the city, this is a must see.

originalText.text: Overall nice theatre! Saw Some Like it Hot here and really enjoyed it. My only complaint is that the seats in the back of the mezzanine (what I won in the lottery) have a very obstructed view - the balcony above obstructs the top third of the stage. For shorter folks, it might not be as much of an issue. Fortunately, I was able to move up to a better seat during the intermission.
